application.doc: Retrieve the configuration for a collection of Redis servers

param.name: appliance_hostname
param.doc: Host name of the appliance.

param.name: collection
param.doc: The name of the collection

method.name: GET
method.id: Retrieve the configuration of a Redis collection
method.doc: To retrieve the configuration of a Redis collection, issue an HTTP GET command on the Redis collection configuration resource URI.

param.name: Authorization
param.doc: Basic Authentication header

param.name: Accept:application/json
param.doc: Required for requests to the service

param.name: Content-Type:application/json
param.doc: Response is in JSON formatting

param.name: name
param.doc: The name of the Redis collection (not required when updating an existing collection).

param.name: matching-hosts
param.doc: Any specific hosts (obtained from the Host header of the HTTP request) for which this collection should be used. Shell-style pattern matching characters, including '*', '?' and '[]', can be specified and used in the comparison.

param.name: max-pooled-connections
param.doc: The maximum number of pooled connections to a Redis server. Default is 50.

param.name: idle-timeout
param.doc: The maximum number of seconds a pooled connection can remain idle before the connection is closed. Default is 10.

param.name: connect-timeout
param.doc: The maximum number of seconds to wait for a connection to be established with a Redis server. Default is 5.

param.name: io-timeout
param.doc: The maximum number of seconds to wait for a valid response from a Redis server. Default is 30.

param.name: health-check-interval
param.doc: The interval (in seconds) between health check requests sent to the Redis server. Default is 15.

param.name: cross-domain-support
param.doc: Configuration information associated with the support for sharing sessions across different DNS domains.

param.name: servers
param.doc: The Redis servers which will be used with this collection.

param.name: master-authn-server-url
param.doc: The base URL of the master authentication server for this collection of Redis servers. The master authentication server, if specified, will be responsible for the generation of all new sessions for this collection. This capability is designed to be used in an environment where you wish to share sessions across multiple DNS domains. The entry should be of the format: http{s}://server{:port}.

param.name: master-session-code-lifetime
param.doc: The maximum number of seconds that a session code, used when communicating the session information from the master authentication server, will remain valid. Default is 30.

param.name: name
param.doc: A label, or name, which is used to identify this server.

param.name: host
param.doc: The server name or IP address of the Redis server.

param.name: port
param.doc: The port on which the Redis server is listening for requests. Default is 6379.

param.name: username
param.doc: The name of the user which is used when authenticating to the Redis server.

param.name: password
param.doc: The password which is used to access the Redis server.

param.name: ssl
param.doc: The SSL information associated with the Redis server.

param.name: trust-cert-labels
param.doc: The labels associated with any trusted certificates used when communicating with the Redis server. The trusted certificates should include the CA certificate for the Redis server certificate, as well as any intermediate certificates used to sign the client certificate (if mutual authentication is in use). The certificates must exist in the key file which is used to secure junction communication within the WebSEAL instance. SSL/TLS will not be used when communicating with the Redis server if no trust certificates are specified.

param.name: client-cert-label
param.doc: The label associated with the client key which is used to perform mutual authentication with the Redis server. This key must exist in the key file which is used to secure junction communication within the WebSEAL instance.

param.name: sni-name
param.doc: The Server Name Indication (SNI) value which is provided when establishing the SSL connection with the Redis server.
